action.action-desc: Ms. Tenney introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to furnish urns for the remains of certain veterans whose remains are placed in non-traditional resting sites.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Chuck Osier Burial Benefits Act.

section.header: Department of Veterans Affairs provision of urns for remains of certain veterans whose remains are placed in non-traditional resting sites
section.text: Section 2306(d) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: In lieu of furnishing a headstone or marker under this subsection to a deceased individual described in subparagraph (B), the Secretary shall furnish, upon request and at the expense of the United States—

clause.text: an urn made of any material to signify the individual’s status as a veteran, in which the remains of such individual may be placed at private expense; or
a commemorative plaque signifying the individual’s status as a veteran.

subparagraph.text: A deceased individual described in this subsection is an individual—

clause.text: who served in the Armed Forces on or after April 6, 1917;
who is eligible for a headstone or marker furnished under paragraph (1) (or would be so eligible but for the date of the death of the individual); and
whose remains were cremated and are placed in a non-traditional resting site.

subparagraph.text: In this paragraph, the term non-traditional resting site means a site of interment or inurnment other than a national cemetery, a State veterans’ cemetery, a tribal cemetery, or a private cemetery.
